info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 1:00PM EDT until October 12 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
At 100 PM EDT, Flash flooding is ongoing across southeastern Georgetown county, including the City of Georgetown. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. While minimal additional rainfall is expected, current flooded areas will be slow to drain, especially with high tide having occurred at 12:45pm. Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning remains in effect until 200 PM EDT due to the slow recession of flood waters across the warned area.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas, especially bordering the local waterways.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Yawkey South Island, Winyah Bay Entrance and Georgetown Memorial Hospital.
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause dangerous flooding, especially near creeks and streams, drainage ditches, and low-lying flood prone areas. Turn around, don't drown if you encounter a flooded road. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from storm drains, culverts, creeks, and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep you away.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN GEORGETOWN COUNTY
